summary: This is an internal DOJ email forwarding citizen correspondence that references Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The Deputy Chief of the Child Exploitation and Obscenity Section forwards the email to colleagues for consideration, noting the standard response is to advise the writer to contact the FBI.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced in citizen correspondence forwarded by DOJ official; central figure in the case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referenced in citizen correspondence forwarded by DOJ official; associate of Epstein.

persons.name: Deputy Chief for Policy and Legislation
persons.context: Author of the email forwarding citizen correspondence about Epstein and Maxwell to colleagues in the Child Exploitation and Obscenity Section.

connections.description: Both are referenced together in citizen correspondence forwarded within the DOJ.

events.title: DOJ Forwards Citizen Correspondence
events.description: Deputy Chief for Policy and Legislation forwards an email containing citizen correspondence referencing Epstein and Maxwell to colleagues for consideration.
personsInvolved: Deputy Chief for Policy and Legislation

keyFacts: The DOJ's Child Exploitation and Obscenity Section received citizen correspondence referencing Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The standard DOJ response to such correspondence is to advise the writer to contact the FBI.
The document shows ongoing public interest and correspondence to the DOJ regarding the Epstein case in November 2021.
